justification: Good recognition of B’s dual-threat QB preference, zero-RB lean, and reliance on consensus, but it overlooks that B highly values rookies—Cameron Scott (Tier 1 rookie) is exactly the type B would avoid trading. It also overstates B’s QB ‘need’ given Holt’s stability and playoff schedule, and doesn’t leverage B’s injury-buy tendency. Trade is feasible but misaligned with B’s philosophy, likely overestimating acceptance and calling it a zero-RB fit despite sacrificing elite WR capital without WR return.
